A

Account - Class in Funds.DataObjects
Summary
Account() - Constructor for class Funds.DataObjects.Account
the default constructor to be used in conjunction with getters and setters
Account(String, boolean) - Constructor for class Funds.DataObjects.Account
For general usage when creating a new account the most important things to know are the name (how to recognize it on the charts) and the normal (which column in the ledger represents an increase), the two-arg constructor implements only this information at creation.
Account(String, String, String, String, String, boolean) - Constructor for class Funds.DataObjects.Account
The full constructor is for creating an account with all the common details, this constructor is intended to be used with a new account dialog interface
AccountCategory - Class in Funds.DataObjects
 
AccountCategory(String, AccountType) - Constructor for class Funds.DataObjects.AccountCategory
 
AccountDialog - Class in Funds.Dialogs
The controller class for the similarly named FXML dialog.
AccountDialog(Book, Account) - Constructor for class Funds.Dialogs.AccountDialog
In order to interact with the account two fields are necessary:
AccountDialog.ComboBoxItem - Class in Funds.Dialogs
list item for combo box so that category labels can be included which requires a factory
AccountType - Enum in Funds.DataEnums
List of the available types of accounts
addAccount() - Method in class Funds.Dialogs.NewAccountDialog
Method to actually create the account from the input fields on the dialog, called when ok button is clicked
addAccountCategory() - Method in class Funds.Dialogs.NewAccountCategoryDialog
method to actually create the category when the ok button is clicked
addTransaction() - Method in class Funds.Dialogs.AccountDialog
uses the values selected/entered for the input fields to create a new Transaction object to represent the details of a real world transaction
addTransfer(Account, boolean) - Method in class Funds.Dialogs.AccountDialog
Internal method to implement double transaction method accounting
ALL - Funds.DataEnums.AccountType
 
ASSET - Funds.DataEnums.AccountType
